body_html:
@TBTop was the creator of +GuildsOfSubstance, a categorized directory of non-political guilds to help older and newer ruqqies find good guilds and support them. He was fairly right-wing but believed that non-political communities growing was essential to the success of this site.

He deleted his account and purged the directory after seeing this dream fail to come to fruition. He believed that only reddit rejects and far righters who mirror political views to Voat were joining. There are more non-pol people leaving then joining which indicate no meaning growth as he hoped for. He saw the echo-chamber as only getting worse as only people who agreed with it are joining. This, coupled with the amount of low effort posts and lack of quality content, led him to make him final decision.

His efforts at making ruqqus a better place for many people (including me) are thoroughly appreciated, and I hope they won't be in vain.

post.body_html:
@TBTop was the creator of +GuildsOfSubstance, a categorized directory of non-political guilds to help older and newer ruqqies find good guilds and support them. He was fairly right-wing but believed that non-political communities growing was essential to the success of this site.

He deleted his account and purged the directory after seeing this dream fail to come to fruition. He believed that only reddit rejects and far righters who mirror political views to Voat were joining. There are more non-pol people leaving then joining which indicate no meaning growth as he hoped for. He saw the echo-chamber as only getting worse as only people who agreed with it are joining. This, coupled with the amount of low effort posts and lack of quality content, led him to make him final decision.

His efforts at making ruqqus a better place for many people (including me) are thoroughly appreciated, and I hope they won't be in vain.
post.title: Goodbye to @TBTop, creator of +GuildsOfSubstance

body: He had good intentions, but he became kind of a dick thinking he was on a constant crusade to purge guilds that he felt weren't properly moderated even if it was something like +Foxes - but he'll be missed, because his intentions were 90% and his efforts were 80% and that's still something :)

body:
I just found one more list by looking through +GuildsOfSubstance/comments. The author is TBTop. Edit: [link](https://ruqqus.com/+GuildsOfSubstance/post/3nvx/music-guilds)

**Music Guilds**

+ProgRock - Progressive rock music

+Boneyard - Old school rock and metal music, anything from soft 70's pop rock to doom metal.- mostly anything rock from the 60s - 80s. The most diverse of my music groups.

+NWOBHM - The music of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal

+Jazz

+JazzFunkFusion - Fusion, jazz, rare groove music

+IronMaiden - English heavy metal band formed in 1975

+CountryMusic

+RealCountry

+Bluegrass

+70sMusic

+OldiesMusic - 1950s & '60s Top-40 pop

+JapaneseMusic

+Metal

+Synthwave

+Music

+vinyl

+BedroomMusicians

+citypop

+SentimentalOldies - Favorite oldies from the Golden Age of American pop music, 1930-1980. Fondly remember when we'd turn on the radio and get our minds blown every week? This is the Guild for you!

+CoverSongs - newer versions of hit songs

post.body_html:
@TBTop was the creator of +GuildsOfSubstance, a categorized directory of non-political guilds to help older and newer ruqqies find good guilds and support them. He was fairly right-wing but believed that non-political communities growing was essential to the success of this site.

He deleted his account and purged the directory after seeing this dream fail to come to fruition. He believed that only reddit rejects and far righters who mirror political views to Voat were joining. There are more non-pol people leaving then joining which indicate no meaning growth as he hoped for. He saw the echo-chamber as only getting worse as only people who agreed with it are joining. This, coupled with the amount of low effort posts and lack of quality content, led him to make him final decision.

His efforts at making ruqqus a better place for many people (including me) are thoroughly appreciated, and I hope they won't be in vain.
